Posts.EditableText: Hi Quest 3.52 is now available. If you're using version 3.51, just go to the Help menu and click "Check for Updates" to get the new version. Otherwise: - Quest users can download the update from http://www.axeuk.com/quest/ - Quest Pro can download the update from the Quest Pro Users Area, at the usual address. Any questions or problems then please let me know. Thanks Alex
Posts.HTML:
Hi

Quest 3.52 is now available. If you're using version 3.51, just go to the Help menu and click "Check for Updates" to get the new version.

Otherwise:
- Quest users can download the update from http://www.axeuk.com/quest/
- Quest Pro can download the update from the Quest Pro Users Area, at the usual address.

Any questions or problems then please let me know.


Thanks
Alex

Posts.EditableText:
Guess I'll be the first to post a problem.  I loaded my asl into the new version of Quest Lite and when I try to connect through Quest I get the following:

"Run-time error '401': Can't show non-modal form when modal form is displayed"

Any thoughts ??

Posts.EditableText: I had that happen with a clock type script I made, I think it's caused by quest trying to alter game properties before the save file has been set or something.
Posts.HTML: I had that happen with a clock type script I made, I think it's caused by quest trying to alter game properties before the save file has been set or something.

Posts.EditableText:
It was actually the server welcome message box ("This server is running QuestNet Server 3.52") that caused Quest to crash when the server was using logins. I can't quite remember what the point of the message box is anyway, so I'll may even remove it entirely, but until then you can avoid the problem simply by setting

[code:ly0q0llv]
    welcome     off
[/code:ly0q0llv]

in the "define options" block.
Posts.HTML:
It was actually the server welcome message box ("This server is running QuestNet Server 3.52") that caused Quest to crash when the server was using logins. I can't quite remember what the point of the message box is anyway, so I'll may even remove it entirely, but until then you can avoid the problem simply by setting


    welcome     off


in the "define options" block.
